inputs.name: bids_dir
inputs.description: The root folder of a BIDS valid dataset (sub-XXXXX folders should be found at the top level in this folder).

inputs.name: output_dir
inputs.description: The output path for the outcomes of preprocessing and visual reports

inputs.name: analysis_level
inputs.description: Processing stage to be run, only "participant" in the case of fMRIPrep (see BIDS-Apps specification).

inputs.name: skip_bids_validation
inputs.description: Assume the input dataset is BIDS compliant and skip the validation

inputs.name: participant_label
inputs.description: A space delimited list of participant identifiers or a single identifier (the sub- prefix can be removed)

inputs.name: task_id
inputs.description: Select a specific task to be processed

inputs.name: echo_idx
inputs.description: Select a specific echo to be processed in a multiecho series

inputs.name: bids_filters
inputs.description: A JSON file describing custom BIDS input filters using PyBIDS. For further details, please check out https://fmriprep.readthedocs.io/en/23.1.3/faq.html#how-do-I-select-only-certain-files-to-be-input-to-fMRIPrep

inputs.name: anat_derivatives
inputs.description: Reuse the anatomical derivatives from another fMRIPrep run or calculated with an alternative processing tool (NOT RECOMMENDED).

inputs.name: bids_database_dir
inputs.description: Path to a PyBIDS database folder, for faster indexing (especially useful for large datasets). Will be created if not present.

inputs.name: nprocs
inputs.description: Maximum number of threads across all processes

inputs.name: omp_nthreads
inputs.description: Maximum number of threads per-process

inputs.name: mem
inputs.description: Upper bound memory limit for fMRIPrep processes

inputs.name: low_mem
inputs.description: Attempt to reduce memory usage (will increase disk usage in working directory)

inputs.name: use_plugin
inputs.description: Nipype plugin configuration file

inputs.name: sloppy
inputs.description: Use low-quality tools for speed - TESTING ONLY

inputs.name: anat_only
inputs.description: Run anatomical workflows only

inputs.name: boilerplate_only
inputs.description: Generate boilerplate only

inputs.name: reports_only
inputs.description: Only generate reports, don't run workflows. This will only rerun report aggregation, not reportlet generation for specific nodes.

inputs.name: ignore
inputs.description: Ignore selected aspects of the input dataset to disable corresponding parts of the workflow (a space delimited list)

inputs.name: output_spaces
inputs.description: Standard and non-standard spaces to resample anatomical and functional images to. Standard spaces may be specified by the form ``<SPACE>[:cohort-<label>][:res-<resolution>][...]``, where ``<SPACE>`` is a keyword designating a spatial reference, and may be followed by optional, colon-separated parameters. Non-standard spaces imply specific orientations and sampling grids. Important to note, the ``res-*`` modifier does not define the resolution used for the spatial normalization. To generate no BOLD outputs, use this option without specifying any spatial references. For further details, please check out https://fmriprep.readthedocs.io/en/23.1.3/spaces.html

inputs.name: longitudinal
inputs.description: Treat dataset as longitudinal - may increase runtime

inputs.name: bold2t1w_init
inputs.description: Either "register" (the default) to initialize volumes at center or "header" to use the header information when coregistering BOLD to T1w images.

inputs.name: bold2t1w_dof
inputs.description: Degrees of freedom when registering BOLD to T1w images. 6 degrees (rotation and translation) are used by default.

inputs.name: force_bbr
inputs.description: Always use boundary-based registration (no goodness-of-fit checks)

inputs.name: force_no_bbr
inputs.description: Do not use boundary-based registration (no goodness-of-fit checks)

inputs.name: slice_time_ref
inputs.description: The time of the reference slice to correct BOLD values to, as a fraction acquisition time. 0 indicates the start, 0.5 the midpoint, and 1 the end of acquisition. The alias `start` corresponds to 0, and `middle` to 0.5. The default value is 0.5.

inputs.name: dummy_scans
inputs.description: Number of nonsteady-state volumes. Overrides automatic detection.

inputs.name: _random_seed
inputs.description: Initialize the random seed for the workflow

inputs.name: me_t2s_fit_method
inputs.description: The method by which to estimate T2* and S0 for multi-echo data. 'curvefit' uses nonlinear regression. It is more memory intensive, but also may be more accurate, than 'loglin'. 'loglin' uses log-linear regression. It is faster and less memory intensive, but may be less accurate.

inputs.name: output_layout
inputs.description: Organization of outputs. "bids" (default) places fMRIPrep derivatives directly in the output directory, and defaults to placing FreeSurfer derivatives in <output-dir>/sourcedata/freesurfer. "legacy" creates derivative datasets as subdirectories of outputs.

inputs.name: me_output_echos
inputs.description: Output individual echo time series with slice, motion and susceptibility correction. Useful for further Tedana processing post-fMRIPrep.

inputs.name: medial_surface_nan
inputs.description: Replace medial wall values with NaNs on functional GIFTI files. Only performed for GIFTI files mapped to a freesurfer subject (fsaverage or fsnative).

inputs.name: project_goodvoxels
inputs.description: Exclude voxels whose timeseries have locally high coefficient of variation from surface resampling. Only performed for GIFTI files mapped to a freesurfer subject (fsaverage or fsnative).

inputs.name: md_only_boilerplate
inputs.description: Skip generation of HTML and LaTeX formatted citation with pandoc

inputs.name: cifti_output
inputs.description: Output preprocessed BOLD as a CIFTI dense timeseries. Optionally, the number of grayordinate can be specified (default is 91k, which equates to 2mm resolution)

inputs.name: use_aroma
inputs.description: Deprecated. Will raise an error in 24.0.

inputs.name: aroma_melodic_dim
inputs.description: Deprecated. Will raise an error in 24.0.

inputs.name: aroma_err_on_warn
inputs.description: Deprecated. Will raise an error in 24.0.

inputs.name: return_all_components
inputs.description: Include all components estimated in CompCor decomposition in the confounds file instead of only the components sufficient to explain 50 percent of BOLD variance in each CompCor mask

inputs.name: regressors_fd_th
inputs.description: Threshold for flagging a frame as an outlier on the basis of framewise displacement

inputs.name: regressors_dvars_th
inputs.description: Threshold for flagging a frame as an outlier on the basis of standardised DVARS

inputs.name: skull_strip_template
inputs.description: Select a template for skull-stripping with antsBrainExtraction (OASIS30ANTs, by default)

inputs.name: skull_strip_fixed_seed
inputs.description: Do not use a random seed for skull-stripping - will ensure run-to-run replicability when used with --omp-nthreads 1 and matching --random-seed <int>

inputs.name: skull_strip_t1w
inputs.description: Perform T1-weighted skull stripping ('force' ensures skull stripping, 'skip' ignores skull stripping, and 'auto' applies brain extraction based on the outcome of a heuristic to check whether the brain is already masked).

inputs.name: fmap_bspline
inputs.description: Fit a B-Spline field using least-squares (experimental)

inputs.name: fmap_no_demean
inputs.description: Do not remove median (within mask) from fieldmap

inputs.name: use_syn_sdc
inputs.description: Use fieldmap-less distortion correction based on anatomical image; if unable, error (default) or warn based on optional argument.

inputs.name: force_syn
inputs.description: EXPERIMENTAL/TEMPORARY: Use SyN correction in addition to fieldmap correction, if available

inputs.name: fs_license_file
inputs.description: Path to FreeSurfer license key file. Get it (for free) by registering at https://surfer.nmr.mgh.harvard.edu/registration.html

inputs.name: fs_subjects_dir
inputs.description: Path to existing FreeSurfer subjects directory to reuse. (default: OUTPUT_DIR/freesurfer)

inputs.name: no_submm_recon
inputs.description: Disable sub-millimeter (hires) reconstruction

inputs.name: fs_no_reconall
inputs.description: Disable FreeSurfer surface preprocessing.

inputs.name: track_carbon
inputs.description: Tracks power draws using CodeCarbon package

inputs.name: country_code
inputs.description: Country ISO code used by carbon trackers

inputs.name: version
inputs.description: show program's version number and exit

inputs.name: verbose_count
inputs.description: Increases log verbosity for each occurrence, debug level is -vvv

inputs.name: work_dir
inputs.description: Path where intermediate results should be stored

inputs.name: clean_workdir
inputs.description: Clears working directory of contents. Use of this flag is not recommended when running concurrent processes of fMRIPrep.

inputs.name: resource_monitor
inputs.description: Enable Nipype's resource monitoring to keep track of memory and CPU usage

inputs.name: config_file
inputs.description: Use pre-generated configuration file. Values in file will be overridden by command-line arguments.

inputs.name: write_graph
inputs.description: Write workflow graph.

inputs.name: stop_on_first_crash
inputs.description: Force stopping on first crash, even if a work directory was specified.

inputs.name: notrack
inputs.description: Opt-out of sending tracking information of this run to the FMRIPREP developers. This information helps to improve FMRIPREP and provides an indicator of real world usage crucial for obtaining funding.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: Debug mode(s) to enable. 'all' is alias for all available modes.
